prompt: <description>**Instructions for Constructing the Final Shape** The final shape is a rectangular prism with rounded corners and edges. It has four holes along its length, evenly spaced. The top and bottom faces are flat, while the side faces are slightly curved. The object is symmetrical along its length and width. **Part 1: Base of the Prism** Construct a rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw the following lines on the sketch, forming a rectangle: - Line 1: Starting point at (0, 0), ending point at (0.75, 0) - Line 2: Starting point at (0.75, 0), ending point at (0.75, 0.525) - Line 3: Starting point at (0.75, 0.525), ending point at (0, 0.525) - Line 4: Starting point at (0, 0.525), ending point at (0, 0) Extrude the sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.0107 towards the normal direction. The result is the base of the prism. **Part 2: Holes in the Prism** Create a new coordinate system at (0.0214, 0.0214, 0.0107) with no rotation. Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Draw the following circles on the sketch: - Circle 1: Center at (0.0143, 0.0143), radius 0.0143 - Circle 2: Center at (0.0143, 0.3786), radius 0.0143 - Circle 3: Center at (0.6357, 0.0143), radius 0.0143 - Circle 4: Center at (0.6357, 0.3786), radius 0.0143 Extrude the sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.0536 towards the normal direction, joining it with the previous part. The result is the base with holes. **Part 3: Rounded Corners and Edges** Create a new coordinate system at (0.0116, 0.5009, 0.0107) with no rotation. Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Draw the following circles on the sketch: - Circle 1: Center at (0.0063, 0.0063), radius 0.0062 - Circle 2: Center at (0.5062, 0.0063), radius 0.0062 Extrude the sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.0 towards the normal direction and 0.0893 towards the opposite direction of the normal. This creates the rounded corners and edges of the prism, cutting material from the previous part. The final CAD model is a rectangular prism with rounded corners and edges and four holes along its length.</description>
